abstract: Buffalo Bills coach Rex Ryan, in teleconference with reporters, discusses disappointing season and personal disappointment at growing criticism from his players; Ryan has already been told he will retain his job for next season, and emphasizes he has high hopes for win in upcoming game with New York Jets that will give team heads-up exit as failed season finally ends.
lead_paragraph: Buffalo’s season, fraught with injuries, disappointment and player unrest, has been reduced to one final game, a chance to deny Ryan’s former team, the Jets, a berth in the postseason.

headline.main: Rex Ryan Looks to End Bills’ Failed Season on High Note
headline.print_headline: Ryan Looks to End Failed Season on a High Note

snippet: Buffalo’s season, fraught with injuries, disappointment and player unrest, has been reduced to one final game, a chance to deny Ryan’s former team, the Jets, a berth in the postseason.
